# spirl_realm_role_assignment (Resource)

Assigns a realm role to a user or service account in SPIRL. Either `user_email` or `service_account_name` must be specified, but not both.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Assign a realm role to a user
resource "spirl_realm_role_assignment" "user_admin" {
  trust_domain_id = spirl_trust_domain.my_domain.id
  realm_name      = spirl_realm.production.name
  role_name       = "Administrator"
  user_email      = "admin@example.com"
}

# Assign a realm role to a service account
resource "spirl_realm_role_assignment" "sa_admin" {
  trust_domain_id      = spirl_trust_domain.my_domain.id
  realm_name           = spirl_realm.production.name
  role_name            = "Administrator"
  service_account_name = "automation-sa"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `realm_name` (String) The name of the realm
- `role_name` (String) The name of the realm role to assign. Valid values are: Administrator.
- `trust_domain_id` (String) The ID of the trust domain

### Optional

- `service_account_name` (String) The name of the service account to assign the role to (mutually exclusive with user_email)
- `user_email` (String) The email of the user to assign the role to (mutually exclusive with service_account_name)

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (String) An RFC3339 timestamp for when the role assignment was created
- `id` (String) The unique identifier for the role assignment

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
#!/bin/bash

# Realm role assignment import uses the assignment id
terraform import spirl_realm_role_assignment.user_admin ra-123456
```
